Comments_List: Learned about how emotion plays a role in our everyday life.
Developed a capacity to read psychology studies
To be frank, I learned very little in this course. I did learn about some classic experiments and theories in emotional psychology, but not very much.
Strength is that its a good balance of information and material. Weakness is that the class is not very engaging.
Strength was the material. Wish there were more discussions as proposed in the syllabus

The lectures were very boring, and they essentially summarized the required readings. There was absolutely no student participation, even when we raised our hands to ask questions. The readings, while occasionally interesting, relied on understanding of topics which had not yet discussed, so I felt lost while reading them. We also had to write discussion questions before every class, which is a good thing, except that we nevernot onceaddressed the discussion questions, so they were never answered or discussed.
Ehh, it depends. If you're looking for an easy 5th class that is also incredibly boring, then take it. His grading is also very easy.
No because the class was not engaging

No. I would not recommend this course to anyone. I took it because it had a low work rating, but between the teaching, the engagement, and the absolute lack of any student participation and discussion, I would not recommend it to anyone else.
